content: Memory-mapped I/O â€” hardware registers mapped into the CPU's address space so they look like ordinary RAM locations. A write to address 0x4000_1000 might toggle a GPIO pin; a read from 0x4001_0004 might fetch an ADC sample. MCU programming is largely MMIO: STM32 and ESP32 SDKs provide register-level abstractions over MMIO addresses.
